channel.title: Catholic sex abuse victim: why do you feel so sorry for him and not for me?
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3OHSRG5ucdM
Bunch of secretly recorded tapes found where a high-ranking cardinal tries to convince an abuse victim not to go to the police.

item.title: Catholic sex abuse victim: why do you feel so sorry for him and not for me?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:358071”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=454584.msg3330391#msg3330391 date=1283427887]

Well, I would define a ‘true Christian’ as someone who lives their life following the teachings of Jesus Christ, which certainly don’t include rape, or protecting rapists.
[/quote]You are forgetting one little detail: This is religion we are talking about, the bible can be interpreted in many ways, no way is “right” or “wrong”, simple as that.

There is most definitely a right and a wrong, the 10 Commandments can’t be interpreted any other way, but the most important rule is to love your neighbor as you love yourself.[/quote]
The 10 Commandments is no longer valid, and nobody keep the 3rd Commandment.

item.source: Catholic sex abuse victim: why do you feel so sorry for him and not for me?

item.title: Catholic sex abuse victim: why do you feel so sorry for him and not for me?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:9, topic:358071”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=454584.msg3328907#msg3328907 date=1283311068]
the Catholic church’s policy is now to go directly to the local authorities first with any questions or allegations of anything, and then to church authorities.
[/quote]

In the video the man says this happened not 20 years ago, but April of this year. Now the raised media coverage of this scandal has been going on since Feburary 2010, so at the very least it means the church waited more than two months to change their policy, if they’ve changed it at all that is.

Its interesting to examine the No True Christian claim because these people not only believed in the divinity and teachings of Jesus Christ but actually gave their lives to their church. I wonder on which basis you can say they weren’t Christians unless you define a Christian as “one who doesn’t rape children”.[/quote]

The policy I mentioned has been in place since at least when the 90s scandal was going on, possibly earlier. I know that if abuse is reported to our deacon or priest, they are instructed to first call local authorities, and only then inform the church.

Well, I would define a ‘true Christian’ as someone who lives their life following the teachings of Jesus Christ, which certainly don’t include rape, or protecting rapists.

Read full topic
item.source: Catholic sex abuse victim: why do you feel so sorry for him and not for me?

item.title: Catholic sex abuse victim: why do you feel so sorry for him and not for me?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

the Catholic church’s policy is now to go directly to the local authorities first with any questions or allegations of anything, and then to church authorities.

In the video the man says this happened not 20 years ago, but April of this year. Now the raised media coverage of this scandal has been going on since Feburary 2010, so at the very least it means the church waited more than two months to change their policy, if they’ve changed it at all that is.

Its interesting to examine the No True Christian claim because these people not only believed in the divinity and teachings of Jesus Christ but actually gave their lives to their church. I wonder on which basis you can say they weren’t Christians unless you define a Christian as “one who doesn’t rape children”.

Read full topic

item.title: Catholic sex abuse victim: why do you feel so sorry for him and not for me?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I didn’t watch the video, but everyone agrees this was bad and was wrong, and the Catholic church’s policy is now to go directly to the local authorities first with any questions or allegations of anything, and then to church authorities.

edit:
Personally, however, I think anyone who abuses anyone sexually should have their junk cut off and then killed in a slow and painful way, regardless. No real Christian would ever do anything like that, regardless of what they call themselves.

Read full topic
